name: St. Edmund Campion
summary: Edmund Campion was an English Jesuit priest and martyr. After converting to Catholicism, he joined the Jesuits and returned to England as a missionary during the reign of Elizabeth I. He was known for his eloquence and learning. He was captured, tortured, and executed at Tyburn in 1581. He is one of the Forty Martyrs of England and Wales and is remembered for his famous 'Brag' defending the Catholic faith.
keyQuotes: In condemning us, you condemn all your own ancestors, all the ancient priests, bishops, and kings.
